reasoning: Microcephaly is a congenital birth defect with global incidence estimated at ~1.5 per 100k live births, based on available epidemiological studies. Incidence varies significantly by region (0.5-3 per 100k) due to differences in risk factors, genetic backgrounds, and maternal infections. Confidence moderate due to geographic variation and limited centralized global surveillance.
source: WHO reports on congenital anomalies and birth defect surveillance; multiple regional epidemiological studies
